column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////Bavette's did the impossible: it achieved a 5/5 on food and drinks IN A TOWN KNOWN FOR GREAT STEAKS AND GREAT STEAK PLACES.  You guys came out swinging for the fences as rookies and hit a grand slam.  I would put the actual steak up there with Smith & Wolinsky
column3: and Chicago Cut.  I always let my server tell me what the chef recommends on anyone cut of steak at a place
column4: and the Classic Chicago cut ribeye was perfectly cooked at medium rare.  It had a healthy sear without being burnt
column6: and had enough au jus for both the dish and the sides later onward.  If you know your steak
column7: this is one to make time to experience.  The knife was not necessary.
